title: Two-round NBA mock draft: We made 22 pick updates based on intel, trades
content: Round 1 of the NBA draft is tonight (8 ET on ABC and ESPN), and we have the intel on trade talks and picks.

title: The 'abrupt reversal of fortune' that changed everything for Cooper Flagg and the Mavs
content: The presumptive No. 1 pick and the Mavs, still reeling from trading Luka Doncic, might be made for each other.

title: Celtics to trade Porzingis to Hawks, sources say
content: Boston, Atlanta and Brooklyn are finalizing a trade that will send Kristaps Porzingis to the Hawks, Terance Mann to the Nets and Georges Niang to the Celtics, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Kyrie to sign new 3-year deal with Mavs
content: Mavericks All-Star guard Kyrie Irving is declining his $43 million player option and intends to sign a three-year, $119 million contract with the franchise, sources told ESPN.

title: 2B Marte in tears after fan's taunt about late mom
content: Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte was visibly upset and in tears on the field after a fan yelled something about his late mother during Wednesday night's game against the White Sox at Chicago's Rate Field.

title: Pirates remove Cruz after he loses track of outs
content: Pittsburgh Pirates veteran outfielder Oneil Cruz, 26, said he lost track of the outs in the seventh inning, when he didn't run out a double-play grounder, a move that led to his removal in his club's 9-3 loss to the Milwaukee Brewers on Tuesday night.

title: NBA owners approve $1.5B sale of Wolves, Lynx
content: The $1.5 billion sale of the Minnesota Timberwolves from Glen Taylor to an investment group led by e-commerce entrepreneur Marc Lore and former baseball star Alex Rodriguez gained NBA approval Tuesday.

title: Reds' Burns fans 1st 5 hitters in his MLB debut
content: Chase Burns, a 22-year old right-hander and the No. 2 pick in 2024, became the first starting pitcher in the expansion era to retire the first five batters he faced via strikeout in his major league debut during the Reds' 5-4 win over the Yankees.

title: Arbiter says NFL urged clubs to limit guarantees
content: An arbiter ruled in January that there was no collusion by NFL clubs in response to a grievance filed by the NFL Players Association in 2022 that alleged the league and its member clubs colluded to restrict or limit fully guaranteed player contracts.

title: Sources: NCAA nears decision on larger tourney
content: A decision on whether or not to expand the NCAA men's and women's basketball tournaments will be made in the upcoming weeks, sources told ESPN.

title: 📈 Ranking top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates
content: More Red Sox stars on the move? A former Cy Young available? Here are the big names your team could be targeting.

title: 30-game winner Paul Skenes?! A new formula to bring pitcher wins back to life
content: MLB's best pitcher has a 1.85 ERA but just a 4-6 record. In the age of analytics, he's not alone. Here's how to fix it.

title: Why Aaron Rodgers' one-and-done plan is great news for the Steelers
content: The Steelers can start planning for the future of the QB position because they don't have to guess about Rodgers' intentions.

title: 'Championships, fan experience, community': After 20 years as Vikings owners, Wilfs have one last goal
content: The Wilf family built a revered stadium and gets rave reviews from players, but the Vikings have yet to win a Super Bowl.

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Who makes the Hall of Fame in 2026? Ranking the top candidates
content: Does Patrice Bergeron make it in his first year eligible? What about Keith Tkachuk? Predicting the next class.

content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: Our one-stop shop for the draft: Mocks, order, big questions and more
content: From teams to watch to our latest mock draft, we have everything you need to know about the 2025 draft.

title: Inside Bryce Steele's journey back to football after battling cancer
content: After battling cancer in 2023, Boston College linebacker Bryce Steele is set to be a starter this fall.

title: From Man City to Flamengo, why every last-16 team will, won't win Club World Cup
content: We're heading into the knockout rounds of the 2025 Club World Cup as the field of 32 splits in half this week. With updated odds and projections, here's why every remaining team will or won't win this thing.

title: Luka Modric agrees to join AC Milan after CWC
content: Luka Modric has verbally agreed to sign for AC Milan, where he will sign a one-year contract, with an option to extend for another year.

title: Barça to return to Spotify Camp Nou on Aug. 10
content: Barça are still expected to begin next season's LaLiga with three away games despite marking their return to the Spotify Camp Nou for the Joan Gamper Trophy.

title: Sources: Atlético reach deal for USMNT's Cardoso
content: Atlético Madrid have reached a verbal agreement with Betis to sign USMNT midfielder Johnny Cardoso, sources have told ESPN.

title: Happy birthday! Newell's name stand after Messi
content: Newell's Old Boys' new stand at their Coloso Marcelo Bielsa stadium has been named after Lionel Messi, announcing the decision on the day the Inter Miami forward turned 38 years old.

title: Sources: Fati to join Monaco on loan from Barça
content: Barcelona's Ansu Fati is set to join AS Monaco on loan next season after both clubs reached a full agreement on Wednesday, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Chelsea near deal for Dortmund's Gittens
content: Chelsea are edging closer to a deal with Borussia Dortmund for winger Jamie Gittens after representatives from the two teams held discussions in the United States during the Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: French giants Lyon relegated over financial issues
content: Seven-time French champions Lyon, owned by American businessman John Textor, have been relegated to the second tier of French football due to the club's financial problems.

title: Will Jake Paul's hook land better than Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.'s?
content: The question is not if Paul can beat a real fighter, but if Chavez, a former champion, can go toe-to-toe with Paul.

title: Power Rankings: Mercury overtake Liberty with five-game winning streak
content: Phoenix has bucked speculation over its new-look roster with 11 wins, including over the defending champions.

title: 'The Ultimate Fighter' Episode 5 recap and everything else you need to know
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: How women's college stars are powering USA Basketball's AmeriCup team
content: LSU's Flau'jae Johnson and TCU's Olivia Miles are among 12 college standouts competing for the U.S. AmeriCup team.

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Defending champion Florida returns to the top line
content: Florida benefited from the transfer portal -- and some key NBA draft withdrawals -- to get to the top line.

title: First overall, first in fashion: No. 1 pick looks through the years
content: From Paolo Banchero's purple suit and "P5" chain to LeBron James' all-white look, fashion statements for NBA top draft picks have evolved greatly over the years.

title: What to know ahead of the Austrian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads into round 11 in Spielberg as McLaren's Oscar Piastri remains championship leader - will the Austrian Grand Prix provide any upsets?

title: For USWNT prospects, it's now or never to impress Emma Hayes
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes plans to decide her core group of players soon, which means it's the last chance for many U.S. prospects.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Everton battle for Ndidi
content: Leicester midfielder Wilfred Ndidi is the subject of interest from Manchester United and Everton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mock draft: Derrick Henry biggest mover in change to non-PPR
content: In this 12-team, non-PPR setup, the Ravens' star back went nearly 10 picks earlier than he has in PPR mocks this summer.

title: Should you take Jeanty over Barkley in fantasy drafts?
content: Is the 2,000-yard RB being undervalued? Or is regression coming for him and the rookie is the better choice?

title: Vice-President Dhankhar faints at Kumaon University programme
content: Noticing something was wrong, the medical team accompanying the Vice-President quickly responded and brought him back to consciousness

title: Axiom-4 mission: ‘What a ride,’ says Shubhanshu Shukla as India returns to human spaceflight
content: “Namaskar, my dear countrymen. What a ride! We have returned to space after a gap of 41 years and what an amazing ride it was,” Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla said

title: Union Cabinet passes resolution marking 50 years of Emergency
content: It was one of the darkest chapters in India’s democratic history; it would never be forgotten, the Prime Minister said

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Ujarulvar village goes fully digital in land transactions, sets national benchmark
content: Landmark achieved through Ente Bhoomi portal developed jointly by the Revenue, Survey and Registration departments

title: Alert on Giant African Snail infestation in Alappuzha district
content: Since the secretions of African snails might contain parasites capable of causing diseases in humans, it is essential to handle and control them with extreme caution

title: On stage, a one-man mission against drug abuse
content: Social activist Ratheesh Varavoor uses mono act as a tool to tackle the growing menace. June 26 is International Day against drug abuse

title: Kerala Cabinet clears framework for the conservation and management of river basins
content: The apex committee, the Kerala River Basin Conservation and Management Authority, will be chaired by the Chief Minister. It is aimed at the overall improvement of water resources management in the State

title: Missing ‘sub-section’ prompts U.P. to delay release of man who got bail, SC orders State to pay him ₹5 lakh compensation
content: “Liberty is a very valuable and precious right guaranteed to persons under the Constitution. It cannot be bartered on these useless technicalities,” SC says, orders judicial enquiry to see if delay was ‘sinister’

title: Bengaluru auto driver assault: After 13-hour struggle, police mention Jai Shri Ram slogan chanting in FIR
content: The Bengaluru police allegedly refused to mention the detail about being asked to chant ‘Jai Shri Ram’ slogan, citing that the issue would turn into a communal problem.

title: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge takes a swipe at Shashi Tharoor, says ‘for some Modi comes first, country later’
content: The Kerala MP hits back, by posting social media message that read - “don’t ask permission to fly, the wings are yours and the sky belongs to none”

title: Teenager and her boyfriend arrested for murder of mother in Hyderabad’s Jeedimetla
content: The teenager had been in a relationship with a 19-year-old DJ from Nalgonda district. The mother, Satla Anjali,  disapproved of the relationship.

title: Nine men trapped in swollen Tawi river rescued in Jammu
content: The weather office has predicted intermittent spells of light to moderate rain and thundershowers at many places with possibility of heavy rain at a few places of Jammu division till June 27

title: Duty doctor, two staff at UPHC in Ranipet suspended for absence during work hours
content: The order comes after Minister for Health and Family Welfare Ma. Subramanian made a surprise visit to the centre around 8 a.m. on Wednesday, during which he found that no staff, including the duty doctor, nurse, and other employees, were present

title: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expresses readiness for 'meaningful dialogue' with India
content: However, India has made it clear that it will only have a dialogue with Pakistan on the return of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir and the issue of terrorism

title: Man denied SBI job over poor credit history; Madras High Court upholds bank’s decision
content: Justice N. Mala observes that State Bank of India has taken a prudent decision not to appoint candidates with poor credit history

title: Telangana | Kazipet Rail Manufacturing Unit to be ready by January 2026
content: Mainline Electric Multiple Unit (MEMU) trains will be manufactured at the Rail Manufacturing Unit in Telangana’s Kazipet

title: Karnataka rains: Flood alert issued as inflow rises into Harangi dam
content: 10,000 cusecs discharged from the dam on June 25 at 4 p.m., outflow may increase as heavy rains lash catchment areas

title: CBSE approves twice-a-year board exams for Class 10 from 2026
content: While first board exam is mandatory in nature, the second board exam is an additional option for students to improve their scores, officials stated

title: Telangana earns 10.2% of projected revenue in first two months of FY 2025-26; expenditure is 12.5%
content: In April and May, Telangana borrowed 17.39% of estimates for the fiscal year. The State paid 21.51% of interest payment estimates, expenditure on salaries was 18.8% and 23.32% on pensions

title: Cabinet approves ₹5,940 crore revised Jharia Master Plan for rehabilitation: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The revised JMP lays a much stronger emphasis on sustainable livelihood generation for families being resettled under the plan

title: Tej Pratap clears interview for commercial pilot license training
content: According to the Directorate of Aviation (Bihar government) on June 20, Mr. Yadav has secured the fifth rank among 18 candidates who cleared the interview and document verification process for the Ab-Initio to CPL course

title: Emergency: Congress leaders should repent on June 25 every year, says Scindia
content: Taking a veiled dig at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Mr. Scindia on Tuesday said nothing can be achieved by just "roaming around" with a copy of the Constitution.

title: Deshabhimani journalist Ragesh Kayalur succumbs to injuries after road accident in Kannur
content: Accident occurred late Sunday night while Ragesh was returning home after duty. He was hit by a lorry on Mattannur-Irrity road

title: T.N. CM Stalin raises concern over proposed railway fare hike, urges Centre to reconsider
content: Mr. Stalin, who left by train to Katpadi from Chennai Central on Wednesday morning to attend official functions in Vellore and Tirupattur districts, said on X that he had interacted with the public at the railway station

title: Low pressure to bring widespread rain in Bengal: IMD
content: Warning that sea conditions are very likely to be rough, the IMD advised fishermen not to venture into the sea along and off the West Bengal-Odisha coast and north Bay of Bengal till Thursday.

title: Puri Rath Yatra to be held under AI-enabled cameras, NSG snipers to watch from rooftops
content: “As this year’s Rath Yatra celebration will be held post-Pahalgam terror attack, security arrangements have been made keeping different aspects in view,” a senior police officer said

title: Hindu Munnani functionary murdered in Tiruppur
content: The deceased Balamurugan, 30, had stepped out after receiving a phone call when he was chased by the assailants and hacked to death on the spot with weapons, the police said

title: ED raids in Delhi-NCR, Punjab in ₹988 crore bank loan 'fraud' case
content: The raids by the Enforcement Directorate is being undertaken against the promoters of a company, Shilpi Cables Technologies Ltd. (SCTL), and some linked entities

title: Former Kerala CM V.S. Achuthanandan remains in ICU for third day, condition stable
content: His condition is being monitored closely by a medical team consisting of specialists, according to medical bulletin

title: ED raids in Gujarat, Maharashtra in ₹100-crore cyber ‘fraud’ case
content: ED raids were conducted in Surat and Ahmedabad in Gujarat and in Mumbai by the Ahmedabad zonal office of the federal probe agency under the provisions of the PMLA

title: Kerala rains: Orange alert for four districts on June 25
content: Hill stations close to high-range areas in north Kerala witness heavy spells, with Meppadi in Wayanad receiving close to 100 mm rains

title: Halt bike taxis which use non-commercial vehicles in Hyderabad; drivers pay for violations: Gig Workers after ban in Karnataka
content: TGPWU president said that unemployed youth are being misled into thinking bike taxi operations are legal. The Union said the services in Hyderabad are provided using non-commercial vehicles

title: India’s alarming vaccination gap: 1.44 million children still ‘zero-dose’, Lancet study reveals
content: The study also highlights a troubling stagnation in worldwide immunisation efforts, leaving millions of vulnerable children, particularly in India and other South Asian nations, susceptible to deadly, preventable diseases

title: Bypoll victories were semifinals for 2027 Assembly polls in Punjab, Gujarat: Arvind Kejriwal
content: Leave anti-incumbency, there is pro-incumbency there. We had won 92 seats in the 2022 Assembly polls, and it looks like we will cross 100 seats in 2027, says Arvind Kejriwal

title: Farmer injured in bear attack in Karnataka
content: Dashrath Warandikar, 60, said the bear attacked him when he went to the edge of the forest to graze his cattle

title: BJP staging drama on Emergency to hide governance failure: Mallikarjun Kharge
content: The government has no answer to unemployment, corruption and economic failure. To hide their lies and failure, they have staged this drama, says Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Lokayukta book suo motu complaint against Karnataka State Pollution Control Board
content: The complaint pertains to alleged dereliction of duty, maladministration, corruption, nepotism and other alleged illegal activities

title: ED raids engineering colleges in Bengaluru in connection with seat blocking scam
content: The colleges include BMS College of Engineering, Akash Institute of Engineering and Technology, and New Horizon College of Engineering

title: Madhya Pradesh Police arrests three for brutally assaulting two men in Sehore
content: The police filed an FIR on June 24 after a purported video of two men being thrashed by a mob and forced to consume animal dung went viral in Madhya Pradesh’s Sehore

title: Man killed as speeding TNSTC bus overturns in Madurai
content: R. Raja, 56, of Allinagaram, who was behind the wheel, lost control of the speeding bus as it approached Aiyapatti junction at around 1 a.m.

title: Nitish Katara murder case: Supreme Court grants 3-month furlough to Sukhdev Yadav
content: A Bench of Justices Ujjal Bhuyan and K Vinod Chandran noted that Yadav has undergone 20 years of uninterrupted incarceration without remission.

title: Uttarakhand: NDRF resumes search for missing pilgrims
content: Five pilgrims were hit by boulders falling from the hillside in the wake of the landslide; two of them have died, and one was rescued in an injured condition

title: Those who had strangled Constitution are now trying to become its protector: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: On the occasion of ‘Samvidhaan Hatya Diwas,’ Assam CM Himanta said in a post, ”As we mark 50 years of this brutal episode, India pays tribute to the brave men and women who stood firm to uphold the Constitution during those dark times”

title: Dangerous flow of mud submerges Attamala road in Kerala’s Wayanad after heavy rains
content: Officials rule out landslide. Punnapuzha experiences drastic rise in water levels, reaching just below the Bailey bridge

title: Landslip reported in Wayanad’s Vellarimala following heavy rains, water level rises in Punnapuzha river
content: But no new landslides inside forests uphill of Punchirimattam, confirms Kerala State Disaster Management Authority

title: ‘Vidya Shakti’ launched in A.P. govt schools to help slow learners catch up in academics
content: In the 5-day training programme, teachers will be briefed on the innovative teaching methods to offer additional coaching in mathematics, science and English to students after school hours

title: ‘Undeclared Emergency@11’: Congress says democracy under ‘five-fold assault’ under Modi government
content: The Congress also claimed that there has been "unbridled hate speech and crackdown on civil liberties"

title: Revised hall tickets released for Andhra Pradesh DSC exams scheduled on July 1 and 2
content: The tests initially scheduled for June 20 and 21, were rescheduled to July 1 and 2, 2025 due to the International Yoga Day celebrations

title: Hit-and-run case: Guntur police seize Jagan Mohan Reddy’s vehicle
content: The police named former A.P. CM Jagan Mohan Reddy as accused number two and the driver of the vehicle as accused number one.

title: Row over Sivaji Ganesan’s bungalow ends with Ram Kumar making final settlement
content: Chief Justice K.R. Shriram and Justice Sunder Mohan dispose of an appeal filed by a finance firm after recording a joint compromise memo filed by both sides

title: Recces, phone calls, fake client ruse: Five, including wife, held for Gadwal man’s murder
content: The police said that the contract killers spent about three months reccing the route from Kurnool to Gadwal before the murder and carefully planning each stage of the crime

title: Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh CMs to inaugurate of VIP block, temple at Tirumala in September
content: The event marks a major step towards improving facilities for devotees from Karnataka visiting the hill shrine of Lord Venkateswara, according to Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy.

title: Foundation stone laid for drinking water project for Gurmitkal
content: The proposed project aimed to provide potable drinking water to the town under the AMRIT 2.0 programme sponsored by the Union Government

title: Road accident injuring five schoolchildren triggers political row in Pravatipuram
content: With allegations that the students were taken to participate in a political protest, HRD Minister Lokesh asks Collector to submit a detailed report

title: Punjab CM meets Governor, seeks space for AAP’s office
content: The Chief Minister said AAP is a national party and it fulfils all conditions for having its office like other political parties in Chandigarh.

title: Disruption of flight services leaves passengers stranded at Kochi airport
content: Services to Doha, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Muscat, Ras al-Khaimah, Bahrain, Dammam, and Kuwait from Kochi airport cancelled; passengers asked to stay updated and check flight status regularly

title: Double-engine government has become a double burden on A.P., says CPI(M)
content: The government has failed in ensuring minimum wages and remunerative prices for farmers, and imposed a heavy burden on people in the form of bills and taxes, says Srinivasa Rao

title: Updates- Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez Head To Venice For Wedding
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez are likely to arrive in Venice on Wednesday, as per reports, for three days of parties to celebrate their wedding in Venice.

title: Bombay High Court Dismisses Plea Challenging Maharashtra Election Results
content: A division bench of the Bombay High Court on Wednesday dismissed a petition seeking to nullify the November 2024 Maharashtra Assembly election results.

title: Vice President Dhankar Faints While Attending Nainital University Programme
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar fainted on Wednesday while attending the Golden Jubilee celebrations of the Kumaon University here.

title: Real Name Faizal, Not Rahul: Delhi Woman Alleges Sexual Exploitation
content: A man has been arrested for sexually exploiting a woman on the pretext of marrying in Delhi, the police said.

title: Days After US Strikes, Iran Confirms Nuclear Facilities "Badly Damaged"
content: Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmail Baghaei confirmed Wednesday the country's nuclear facilities had been "badly damaged" in American strikes over the weekend.

title: Iranian Boy, 2, In Coma After Man Slams Him To Floor At Moscow Airport
content: A disturbing video shows the moment a man suddenly picks up an Iranian boy and slams him to the floor in the arrivals hall of a Moscow airport.

title: Trump Compares Strikes On Iran To Hiroshima Bombing, Says "It Ended The War"
content: Trump said that the US Defence Intelligence Agency "really don't know" about the damage and further stated that damage to Iran's facilities can be fully gauged only after Israel delivered an assessment.

title: After US Strikes, UN Watchdog Wants Iran Nuclear Sites Inspected On Priority
content: UN nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi said on Wednesday his top priority is getting his inspectors back to Iran's nuclear facilities to assess the impact of US and Israeli military strikes and verify its stocks of enriched uranium.

title: Security Forces Foiled Coup Plot Involving Senior Cleric, Says Armenia PM
content: Armenia's Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan on Wednesday said security forces had foiled a coup plot involving a senior cleric, amid his escalating standoff with the leadership of Armenia's Apostolic Church.

title: 4, Including A Newborn, Killed As Car Falls In Canal In Uttarakhand's Haldwani
content: A four-day-old child among four members of a family died after their car fell into a canal at Haldwani in Uttarakhand's Nainital district on Wednesday, police said. The family was returning after child's delivery.

title: Supreme Court Backs Preventive Detention Of Cyber Criminals. What It Means
content: Amid growing cyber threats across the country, the Tamil Nadu government adopted a strong approach by detaining cybercriminals under preventive detention laws.

title: Nitish Katara Murder Convict Sukhdev Pehalwan Gets Supreme Court Relief
content: The Supreme Court has granted a three-month furlough to Sukhdev Pehalwan, a convict in the Nitish Katara murder case.

title: "Wings Are Yours": Shashi Tharoor's 'Permission' Post After M Kharge's Snub
content: Weighing in on the chatter over senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor's praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief Mallikarjun Kharge today said it's "country first for us, but for some people, it's Modi first".

title: Panic In Ranchi Village As Tiger Takes Shelter Inside Home
content: Panic gripped Mardu village in Kocho Panchayat under Silli block of Ranchi district in Jharkhand early Wednesday morning after a full-grown tiger strayed into a residential house and remained holed up inside for over 12 hours.

title: "Those Who Did Not Contribute...": Congress Vs BJP On Emergency@50
content: The 50th anniversary of Emergency turned a political flashpoint with the BJP declaring it "Samvidhan Hatya Divas (Murder of Constitution Day" and the Congress alleging it is just a diversionary tactic.

title: Centre Approves Rs 5,940 Crore For Revised Jharia Master Plan
content: The government on Wednesday approved the Rs 5,940-crore revised Jharia Master Plan (JMP) to deal with fire and rehabilitation of affected families.

title: Union Cabinet Resolves To Honour Sacrifices Of Emergency Victims
content: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday observed brief silence as a mark of tribute to the victims of the Emergency and resolved to commemorate and honour their sacrifices.

title: Ex Taiwan Soldier Sentenced To Two Years In Prison After Spying For China
content: Taiwan's High Court on Wednesday sentenced a former soldier to two years and two months in prison for photographing and leaking confidential military documents to China.

title: Ad Shoot Organiser Arrested For Allegedly Raping French Tourist In Udaipur
content: The casting director of an advertisement shoot has been arrested by the Udaipur Police for allegedly raping a French tourist in the Rajasthan city.

title: Mozambican Robotics Student Invents Futuristic Smart Glasses For Visually Impaired
content: When Armando Ernesto Chau straps on the futuristic smart glasses that a young Mozambican robotics student is developing in the family dining room, he has a vision of a life less confined to his modest home.

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal so far
content: the offseason is here, and trades are already being agreed to across the league . the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets .

title: MCWS 2025: What it means for LSU, favorite moments, 2026 predictions
content: the 2025 MCWS broke away from last year's SEC/ACC takeover . the tournament was the 75th anniversary of the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska . analysts share their favorite moments from the tournament and offer predictions for 2026 .

title: Frequent transfers of higher education secretaries in Tamil Nadu a cause of concern
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The Hindu On Books Books of the week .

title: Stealth leak: India‑born B‑2 engineer sold secrets to China - Espionage revisited
content: Noshir Sheriarji Gowadia, an Indian-American engineer, aided in the creation of America's B-2 stealth bomber. He later betrayed the US by selling classified information to China. This information helped China develop undetectable exhaust systems. Gowadia was arrested and convicted of espionage. He is currently serving a 32-year sentence. His actions now resurface amid geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Don't ask permission': Tharoor's cryptic post after Kharge's 'Modi first' jibe
content: Following Mallikarjun Kharge's indirect criticism of Shashi Tharoor for praising Narendra Modi, Tharoor posted a cryptic message about independence. Kharge questioned Tharoor's priorities, emphasizing "nation first." Tharoor defended his article, clarifying it wasn't a sign of joining the BJP but a statement of national unity.

title: 'Badly damaged’: In a first, Iran admits impact on nuclear sites in US strikes
content: Iran has acknowledged that recent US strikes caused significant damage to its nuclear installations. This admission follows President Trump's claims that the strikes "obliterated" Iran's nuclear program. Trump asserted that Iran's nuclear ambitions have been significantly delayed, drawing a controversial parallel to the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: IND vs ENG: Former selector slams India - 'Those were simple catches, no one drops those'
content: India faced a defeat against England in the first Test at Headingley. Kiran More emphasized the importance of fielding. He noted dropped catches proved costly. England chased down 371 runs. Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, and Yashasvi Jaiswal scored centuries in the first innings. More believes the team is in transition. He asks for time and support for the new players.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions; What experts are saying
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: Bikram Majithia arrested: SIT uncovers Rs 540 crore drug money trail
content: Punjab Vigilance Bureau alleges Bikram Singh Majithia laundered drug money. The Bureau claims illicit funds were laundered through various channels. Unaccounted cash deposits, foreign entities, and unexplained deposits are under scrutiny. The SIT found evidence of property acquisitions without legitimate income sources. A search was conducted at Majithia's Amritsar residence.

title: IND vs ENG: India fast bowler released from squad ahead of 2nd Test in Birmingham
content: India's Harshit Rana has been released from the Test squad before the second match against England. This decision follows after India's loss at Headingley, despite their impressive 835 runs and five centuries. England's remarkable chase of 371, led by Ben Duckett's 149, secured a five-wicket victory. India aims to level the series in the upcoming Edgbaston Test on July 2.

title: Explained: The new CBSE Class 10 board exam system
content: Starting in 2026, CBSE will implement a biannual Class 10 board exam system, offering students two chances each academic year—one mandatory and one optional for improvement. As per NEP-2020, the move aims to reduce exam stress and increase flexibility. Students may improve up to three subjects, and only the best score will be retained. The policy includes specific rules for special categories, result handling, and provisional Class XI admission based on first exam results.

title: ‘We crashed AI 171’: Chennai techie creates fake IDs; uses 80 numbers to trap colleague
content: Rene Joshlida, a robotics engineer from Chennai, has been arrested for sending hoax bomb threats across 11 states. Motivated by unrequited feelings for a former colleague, she created fake email IDs and used VPNs to frame him.

title: 500% tariff on Russia? Will Trump tighten economic screws on Kremlin
content: Donald Trump's administration might not increase sanctions on Russia. Secretary of State Marco Rubio wants room for peace talks. He fears more sanctions could halt negotiations with Russia regarding Ukraine. The US hasn't lifted existing sanctions. The White House is working on tariffs for countries importing Russian energy. Russia aims to gain territory through military action. The US believes this will be difficult for Russia to achieve.

title: Next-gen highway: Dwarka Expressway gets India’s first AI traffic system
content: India has launched its first Advanced Traffic Management System (ATMS) project on the Dwarka Expressway in Delhi, aligning with NHAI's 2023 guidelines. This AI-powered system, covering 56.46 km, integrates traffic monitoring cameras, incident detection, and enforcement systems. It aims to enhance road safety by detecting traffic violations and disseminating information, setting a national benchmark for intelligent traffic management.

title: Magnus Carlsen lost to 9-year-old Indian? All you need to know
content: Nine-year-old Aarit Kapil drew against world champion Magnus Carlsen in an online chess tournament, showcasing his impressive skills. While Aarit competed in Georgia, V Pranav secured first place in the 'Early Titled Tuesday' event. Carlsen also achieved a historic 2900 rating in freestyle chess, surpassing his previous classical peak and demonstrating his dominance in the chess world.

title: AI heat at Amazon: CEO says jobs may go; staff respond with ‘Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday’
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: New nuclear threat: Pakistan developing ballistic missile that could hit US
content: US intelligence indicates Pakistan is developing an ICBM, potentially capable of reaching the United States. This pursuit challenges the existing strategic landscape, possibly aiming to deter US intervention. The acquisition could redefine US-Pakistan relations, as historically, nations with such capabilities haven't been considered allies, raising concerns about nuclear escalation.

title: 'Like Hiroshima': Trump says US strike on Iran ended war
content: President Trump asserted that US strikes have significantly crippled Iran's nuclear capabilities, setting them back decades and preventing bomb construction. He likened the strikes' impact to the end of World War II, while also claiming a ceasefire brokered between Iran and Israel is progressing well. Trump dismissed reports suggesting the strikes were ineffective, labeling them as "fake news."

title: Ax-4 launch: Yuvraj reacts to Shukla's milestone - 'This is a moment we’ll ...'
content: India celebrates the successful launch of the Axiom-4 mission, marking its return to human spaceflight after 41 years. Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, aboard the SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, carries the aspirations of 1.4 billion Indians to the International Space Station. Prime Minister Modi and former cricketer Yuvraj Singh expressed national pride.

title: CBSE approves biannual Class 10 board exams
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will conduct Class 10 board exams twice a year starting in 2026. The first phase will be mandatory, while the second phase will be optional, allowing students to improve their scores with the best result being retained. Internal assessments will be held once annually. This policy aims to reduce exam stress, offer flexibility, and enhance learning outcomes, marking a major reform in India’s education system.

title: Ax-4 launch successful: Shukla is 1st Indian in space in 40yrs; will be first ever at ISS
content: The Axiom-4 mission, carrying Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla and three international crewmates, successfully launched to the International Space Station after delays. Shukla, as pilot, marks a significant step for India in space exploration. The crew will conduct over 60 science experiments during their two-week stay, contributing to research in various fields before returning to Earth.

title: Axiom Mission 4: Shukla’s playlist had this SRK song; a 'Swades' moment
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the pilot of the Axiom Mission 4, shared his favourite song ahead of the launch from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in Florida. Unveiling his launch day playlist, the Indian pilot revealed that he loves to listen to Shah Rukh Khan's 'Swades' movie song 'Yuh Hi Chala Chal'.

title: ‘Hopefully will purchase…’: Trump says China can get Iran oil, but wants it to buy from US
content: Following an Israel-Iran ceasefire, President Trump suggested China could continue purchasing Iranian oil, though the White House clarified this wasn't an easing of US sanctions. Despite Trump's call for China to buy more US oil, analysts doubt this will significantly alter China's import patterns, given existing trade dynamics and Beijing's energy security priorities.

title: 'Unimaginable horrors': Cabinet passes resolution on Emergency; observes 2-minute silence
content: The Union Cabinet, led by PM Modi, condemned the Emergency's 50th anniversary, observing a silence for victims and honoring those who resisted it. PM Modi called it a dark chapter, criticizing the Congress for subverting the Constitution. A new book, 'The Emergency Diaries,' highlights Modi's role in opposing the Emergency.

title: A shock declaration and then violations: How Iran-Israel ceasefire unfolded
content: President Trump brokered a ceasefire between Israel and Iran after airstrikes and missile launches threatened regional war. The agreement, achieved through unconventional diplomacy and social media, followed US bombing of Iranian nuclear sites and retaliatory strikes. Despite the truce, violations occurred, and uncertainty remains about its durability and the future of Iran's nuclear program, raising concerns about lasting peace.

title: Axiom-4: How Shukla's ISS experiments will help Isro's Gaganyaan mission
content: Shubhanshu Shukla is set to embark on a 14-day mission to the International Space Station as part of the Axiom mission, alongside representatives from Hungary and Poland. This flight is a crucial step for India's Gaganyaan program, aiming for a crewed mission by 2027.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' box office collection day 6: Aamir Khan starrer nears Rs 80cr
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' made a strong debut. The film earned well due to positive reviews. Collections soared over the weekend. However, the movie experienced a significant decline on Monday. Tuesday's earnings remained steady. Wednesday collections show a further drop. The film is performing well in multiplexes. Total collections stand at Rs 76.93 crore.

title: ‘Biggest risk of my life’: Ambani says even if Jio had failed, it would have been ‘worth it’
content: Mukesh Ambani considers launching Reliance Jio in 2016 as his biggest gamble with financial analysts' skeptical. Jio's affordable data plans revolutionized India's telecommunications sector, driving down costs and enabling widespread internet access.

title: 'For some, Modi is first': Mallikarjun Kharge takes dig at Shashi Tharoor
content: Mallikarjun Kharge criticised Shashi Tharoor's praise of PM Modi's global efforts, questioning Tharoor's priorities. Kharge emphasised the importance of national unity and supporting the army, while Tharoor defended his article as a statement of national interest related to Operation Sindoor. Tharoor dismissed speculations of joining the BJP, asserting his commitment to serving India.

title: ICC Test Rankings: Pant registers career-high ranking, Bumrah holds firm
content: Rishabh Pant's historic twin centuries at Headingley propelled him to seventh in ICC Test rankings, while Ben Duckett's stellar performance secured him eighth position. Shubman Gill climbed to 20th after a century. Jasprit Bumrah remains the top Test bowler. In T20Is, Michael Levitt and Brandon McMullen made significant gains, reflecting the growing competitiveness in international cricket.

title: DA case: Akali leader Majithia arrested after raids by Punjab Vigilance Bureau
content: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia was arrested on Wednesday after Punjab’s Vigilance Bureau conducted a surprise raid at his Amritsar residence. The unannounced search by nearly a dozen officials led to protests from Majithia’s family. Tensions escalated when Majithia’s wife, Ganieve Kaur, confronted the officers, alleging they entered without warning.

title: 'Shukla carries with him hopes of 1.4bn': PM Modi hails Ax-4 launch; wishes crew success
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated the successful launch of the Axiom-4 mission to the International Space Station, emphasizing that Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla embodies the dreams of 1.4 billion Indians. Modi highlighted Shukla's pioneering journey as the first Indian to visit the ISS.

title: 'Jai Hind, Jai Bharat': Astronaut Shukla's first message from space - watch
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's enthusiastic message from space marked India's return to space exploration after 40 years, orbiting Earth at 7.5km/sec. Aboard the Dragon Capsule "Grace," the Ax-4 mission, including commander Peggy Whitson, is en route to the ISS, emphasizing international collaboration and scientific advancement. The mission involves precise orbital maneuvers and docking procedures before the crew begins conducting experiments.

title: 'BJP got rattled': Kharge calls PM Modi's Emergency reminder a cover-up for failures
content: Marking 50 years since the Emergency, Prime Minister Modi termed it a 'Samvidhan Hatya Diwas,' criticizing the Congress for suppressing democracy. In response, Congress President Kharge accused the BJP of using the anniversary to deflect from their own governance failures, including unemployment and inflation.

title: IND vs ENG | Gill 'didn't quite have that on-field aura' as Kohli, Rohit: Nasser Hussain
content: Following India's defeat in the Leeds Test, former England captain Nasser Hussain critiqued Shubman Gill's captaincy debut, noting a lack of commanding presence compared to Kohli and Sharma. Hussain echoed Ravi Shastri's concerns about India's search for a seam-bowling all-rounder and highlighted issues with slip catching and lower-order batting collapses, which contributed to England's victory.

title: Axiom-4: Shukla lifts off as emotional mother watches from Lucknow
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's family celebrated at his former school in Lucknow as he prepared for his spaceflight. As pilot of Axiom Mission 4, Shukla is set to launch from NASA’s Kennedy Space Centre for a 14-day ISS journey. Following Rakesh Sharma's footsteps after 41 years, Shukla aims to inspire Indian youth.

title: 'Darkest chapters': PM Modi flays Congress for 1975 Emergency
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, called the imposition of the Emergency a dark chapter in India's history and a violation of the Constitution. He accused the Congress party of arresting democracy and highlighted the sacrifices of those who fought against the Emergency. Apart from him, other BJP members also slammed the Congress for 1975 Emergency.

title: 'Fake news': Trump goes ballistic after US intel contradicts his Iran claims
content: Donald Trump refuted a CNN report alleging the US strikes on Iran's nuclear program were ineffective, labeling it "FAKE NEWS" and asserting the sites were "completely destroyed." White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt also dismissed the report as "flat-out wrong," while Special Envoy Steve Witkoff condemned the intelligence leak as "treasonous," insisting on the site's obliteration.

title: 'I can’t afford to pay': Dwyane Wade’s wife opens up about financial pressures
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Big cheer! EPFO auto settlement limit hiked to Rs 5 lakh; ATM withdrawals soon
content: The EPFO has increased the auto-settlement threshold for provident fund advance withdrawals from ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh, enabling quicker access to funds for members, especially during emergencies. This enhancement allows claims up to ₹5 lakh to be processed automatically within three days.

title: From launch to ISS docking and return: Key details of Axiom-4 mission explained
content: Axiom Mission is set to launch carrying astronauts, including India's Shubhanshu Shukla, to the International Space Station (ISS) for a two-week research mission. Docking is scheduled for Thursday, initiating an extensive scientific program with studies from 31 nations. The crew will conduct experiments in microgravity, focusing on areas like cancer research, 3D printing, and DNA repair, contributing to global scientific advancement.

title: Halwa, and a surprise: What astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla is taking to ISS
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla embarked on the Axiom Mission 4 to the ISS, marking India's return to space after 41 years. Carrying scientific instruments and Indian sweets like mango nectar and halwa, Shukla also takes a souvenir for his mentor, Rakesh Sharma. The mission includes experiments and a zero-gravity indicator toy swan, representing wisdom and resilience.

title: TS LAWCET & PGLCET 2025 Results Today: Rank cards releasing; step-by-step guide to download
content: The Telangana State Council of Higher Education will announce the TS LAWCET and PGLCET 2025 results today, June 25, at 4 PM. Conducted by Osmania University, the exams serve as gateways for LLB and LLM admissions in Telangana. Final answer keys are also expected today. Results will be available at lawcet.tsche.ac.in.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla’s career path: From pilot to astronaut; How he became India’s space trailblazer
content: As Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla prepares for liftoff aboard the Axiom-4 mission, he stands on the brink of history as India’s first astronaut to stay aboard the International Space Station. A decorated Indian Air Force pilot and aerospace engineer, Shukla’s career blends elite military training with scientific precision, marking a new era for India’s human spaceflight ambitions.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's pre-launch video released; Ax-4 lifts off to ISS; dedicates mission to India
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla made history on June 25, 2025, as the first Indian to travel to the ISS on a commercial mission. Aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon, Shukla and his international crewmates are en route to the ISS for a two-week research mission. Shortly after liftoff, Shukla expressed his pride, dedicating the mission to India and its burgeoning space program.

title: WATCH: Jaiswal takes England fans' mocking like a champ - dances it off!
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's century in the first Test against England was overshadowed by his poor fielding. He dropped four catches, costing India crucial runs. England fans mocked him. Ben Duckett and Joe Root led England to victory. Gautam Gambhir defended Jaiswal. Shubman Gill acknowledged the dropped catches and batting collapses contributed to the loss. He hopes for improvement in future matches.

title: 'Undeclared emergency': Cong slams Modi govt; alleges 5-fold attack on democracy
content: The Congress party has launched a strong attack on the Modi government, alleging an "undeclared emergency" and a five-fold assault on Indian democracy. They accuse the government of weakening the Constitution, using tax terrorism, controlling the media, misusing investigative agencies, and suppressing civil liberties.

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: Which fringe U.S. players are stepping up at the Gold Cup?
content: the "Futbol Americas" crew discuss the 2-1 win over Haiti . Mauricio Pochettino's men's national team will step up and deliver the kind of performances . some less experienced players have stepped up in the midfield .

title: Zohran Mamdani’s biggest victory? From pestering Mira Nair to winning NYC’s mayoral primary
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers . read more First garden series: 10 products one must have to start a balcony garden in 2025 10 Stunning ethnic looks of Binny Sebastian to 'True Beauty'
